title: Stars coach Ruff criticizes team for 'playing pond hockey'
text:
Stars coach Ruff criticizes team for 'playing pond hockey' FOXSports 17 hrs ago Â© Christian Petersen/Getty Images Lindy Ruff does not like what he sees out of his team so far this season. The Dallas Stars entered camp this fall vowing to be better on offense, but that mission is not going well so far. The Stars lost 4-1 on Tuesday night and have now allowed 20 goals over five preseason games while compiling a 1-4-0 record.
AdChoices Dallas coach Lindy Ruff is not happy.
"It was disappointing," Ruff said to reporters after Tuesday's loss . "We didn't compete hard enough. I thought some guys did, but they won the puck battles, we threw some pucks away and I thought our power play played pond hockey. That was frustrating."
The Stars are giving goalies Antti Niemi and Kari Lehtonen both a chance to prove themselves in the preseason, but neither is stepping up as a No. 1 goalie. Niemi played in net Tuesday and stopped 24 of 28 shots for a .857 save percentage. He now has a .851 save percentage through two games, while Lehtonen is faring even worse with a .816 save percentage and nine goals against in two games.
Obviously some of those poor statistics fall on the defense, but after making defense a priority this offseason, the Dallas Stars will need to come up with some answers in their own zone quickly.
(h/t Dallas Morning News )
